      • removeAndOrphan

        public static <T,C extends EntityWithId<?>> void removeAndOrphan(Consumer<C> setChild,
                                                                 Consumer<T> setParent)

      • addAndParent

        public static <T,C extends EntityWithId<?>> void addAndParent(T thisEntity,
                                                              Collection<C> childEntities,
                                                              C childEntity,
                                                              Consumer<C> handleRemoveChild,
                                                              Consumer<T> handleSetParent)
        Adds a the provided entity to the collection and sets the parent of that entity. If the collection contains the given child, where equals() evaluates to true, that child will be removed from the collection before adding the given child. It is recommended that the handleRemoveChild implementation use @{link removeAndOrphan(Collection, EntityWithId, Consumer)}
        Type Parameters:
        T - the parent type
        C - the child type
        Parameters:
        thisEntity - the parent entity (this)
        childEntities - the collection of child entities
        childEntity - the child entity to add
        handleRemoveChild - the method to remove a child from the collection
        handleSetParent - the method to set the parent of the child

      • removeAndOrphan

        public static <T,C extends EntityWithId<?>> void removeAndOrphan(Collection<C> childEntities,
                                                                 C childEntity,
                                                                 Consumer<T> handleSetParent)
        Removes the given child entity from the given collection. If more than one child exists in the collection where equals() evaluates to true, all of these entities will be removed. The parent of the provided child entity will be set to null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the parent type
        C - the child type
        Parameters:
        childEntities - the collection of entities
        childEntity - the child entity to remove
        handleSetParent - the method to set the child entity parent

      • clearAndOrphan

        public static <T,C extends EntityWithId<?>> void clearAndOrphan(Collection<C> childEntities,
                                                                BiConsumer<C,T> handleSetParent)
        Removes all entities from the collection and sets the parents of those entities to null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the parent type
        C - the child type
        Parameters:
        childEntities - the entity collection
        handleSetParent - the method to set the entity parent

      • equals

        public static <T extends EntityWithId<?>> boolean equals(T thisEntity,
                                                         Object obj)
        Uses the entity ID to determine equality. If two entities are the same object, true will be returned. If two entities have the same non-null ID, true will be returned. If either or both IDs are null, false will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the entity type
        Parameters:
        thisEntity - the entity represented by "this"
        obj - the other object to compare with
        Returns:
        true if both objects are the same or have the same non-null ID

      • hashCodeFinalId

        public static <T extends EntityWithId<?>> int hashCodeFinalId(T thisEntity)
        Returns the hash code for the entity ID. This method can only be used when the ID is guaranteed to be effectively immutable and non-null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the entity type
        Parameters:
        thisEntity - the entity with an immutable ID
        Returns:
        a hash code for the entity based on the ID

      • hashCodeGeneratedId

        public static int hashCodeGeneratedId()
        Returns a constant value. This is used to maintain the equals + hashcode contract when an ID is mutable. This will effect performance, but is necessary in this situation.
        Returns:
        a constant hash code
